pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.2.13_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.2.14.1_0: ‘If a monk who is angry and displeased, using an unrelated legal issue as a pretext, charges a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, aiming to make him leave the monastic life,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:1.2.15_0: and then after some time, whether he is questioned or not, it is clear that the legal issue is unrelated and used as a pretext, and he admits to his ill will, he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.10_0: A legal issue arising from a dispute is related to a legal issue arising from a dispute.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.13_0: How is a legal issue arising from an offense unrelated to a legal issue arising from an offense?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.14_0: An offense entailing expulsion in regard to sexual intercourse is unrelated to an offense entailing expulsion in regard to stealing, an offense entailing expulsion in regard to a human being, and an offense entailing expulsion in regard to a superhuman quality.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.25_0: A legal issue arising from business is related to a legal issue arising from business.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.2.26_0: It is in this way that a legal issue is related to a legal issue.
